bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 163, Number 204 (Thursday, December 14, 2017)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. EMMER:H.R. 4648.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8, Clause 18[Page H9940]

item.name: Consumer Protection and Financial Institutions Subcommittee
Consumer Protection and Financial Institutions Subcommittee

item.text: Hearings Held by the Subcommittee on Financial Institutions and Consumer Credit Prior to Referral.
Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

summary.text:
Home Mortgage Reporting Relief Act of 2017

This bill delays the effective date of specified regulations issued by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau regarding the compilation and reporting of home-mortgage data by depository institutions. The bill also suspends certain home-mortgage data-publishing requirements for depository institutions.

bill.title: Home Mortgage Reporting Relief Act of 2017

item.title: Home Mortgage Reporting Relief Act of 2017
Home Mortgage Reporting Relief Act of 2017
To delay the effective date of certain regulations relating to home mortgage disclosures, to suspend certain data sharing requirements, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Hearings Held by the Subcommittee on Financial Institutions and Consumer Credit Prior to Referral.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
